definition: to use one's strength to mistreat people (idiom)/to bully
to rely on/mother (formal)
strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
variant of 強|强[jiang4]
variant of 強|强[qiang3]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort
variant of 強|强[qiang2]
surname Qiang
stubborn/unyielding
to take unfair advantage of/to deceive/to cheat
weak/feeble/young/inferior/(following a decimal or fraction) slightly less than

sentences.english: The bully shoved aside the little boy.
sentences.chinese: 该恃强欺弱者把这个小男孩推到了一边。

sentences.english: A bully is always a coward.
A hwoulsf truthsy is surely a coward.
Take the bullying that goes on among children, a common form of aggression.
sentences.chinese: 就拿发生在儿童之间的恃强欺弱行为来说。

sentences.english: A hhasf truthsy is constishly a coward.

to stir up trouble
